text: hello everyone my name is Pedro Zamora
and I am a software development engineer

through how you can get started with

through a quick introduction to Amazon

blueprint then we will introduce a

that covers the core functionalities of
this
blueprint finally we'll take you through

you can implement this workflow in
Amazon data Zone yourself so let's get
started Amazon data zone is an AWS
service that allows you to catalog
discover share govern and analyze data
across organizational boundaries if you
are not already familiar with data Zone
please visit our first getting started
video for more context it will be linked
in the video description now let's
quickly go over the infrastructure that
powers data
Zone inside of a data Zone domain you
can create project
these projects are then used as
ownership entities within data Zone when
you create a project you creating a
logical container to add members but for
these members to work with data and
analytics tools they need storage tools
and necessary IM permissions deployed
those deployments are managed using
Blueprints and
environments data Zone blueprints Define
what AWS tools and services are
provisioned to be used within an
environment out of the box data Zone has
a few default blueprints ready to use
these include default data Lake default
data warehouse and default sag maker
with more on the way data Zone
administrators can use the console to
enable or disable These Blueprints in
each Associated account as a c
fit to give more flexibility for you to
bring your resources we are introducing
the custom Ado service blueprint this
provides a container for you to Define
what resources should be used by Amazon
data
Zone the custom ads service blueprint
does not provision any resources unlike
the other default blueprints
instead customers can configure their
AWS IMR to integrate their existing
Resources with data
Zone additionally customers can
configure action links which provide
Federated access to any AWS resource
like S3 buckets glue ETL jobs and more
using the IM Ro configured by the
customer so let's explore a sample
custom AWS service blueprint workflow we
will Implement using data Zone in this
scenario the marketing team wants to
onboard the sales team AWS account to
their domain to access data in their
glue database but the sales team have
sensitive Resources with I permissions
already defined so they want to use a
bring your own R setup meaning custom IM
rolles instead of the data Zone
defaults the sales team would also like
to set up custom action links to S3 and
Athena in their environment each team
would like to publish their own data and
subscribe to data from the other
account these are the different steps we
will go through we we will first step
into the shoes of the marketing team's
data Zone administrator to associate the
sales team's ads account to their domain
then we will switch to the role of the
sales teams data Zone administrator to
accept this Association enable their
custom ads service blueprint and create
a custom environment we'll configure the
environment to use our custom I IM Ru
set up an action link to our S3 bucket
and Athena work group and then connect
the environment to our glue database
finally we'll step into the shoes of a
data Zone portal user to publish
subscribe and query data from each
account so let's build this use case on
data Zone we'll assume you have one ABS
account with a pre-existing data Zone
domain and default data Lake environment
and another ABS account with a glue
database that you would like to injust
data

our domain in our D Zone domain let's
click request Association
then enter in the sales team's adbs
account
ID here we can select if this account

we'll leave that as default for now
click request
Association now let's switch into the

we should now see an association request

default data Lake and data warehouse

for now let's leave These Blueprints

Federated role directly from the portal
we can set up console links to any AWS

Target and data source to the glue
